author: jason.carver
content: Ah, transport independence seems important. I think we were assuming libp2p would force us into TCP. <@!364458974906548225> in doing benchmarks of uTP vs libp2p, it seems like we'd want to compare libp2p on quic

author: pipermerriam
content: I've heard "transport agnostic" as a selling point of libp2p but it's not clear to me how that plays out in reality. It's the bridging between two nodes with incompatible transports something that "just works"?

author: pipermerriam
content:
Looking at this implementation of DiscV5 (over libp2p?) https://github.com/ChainSafe/discv5/blob/671a9ac8ec59ba9ad6dcce566036ce4758fe50a7/src/transport/udp.ts

Still trying to figure out what it is actually doing or whether it's actually compatible with the core protocol or just an implementation of it on top of libp2p (but not actually compatible with the core protocol).
